The Waterloo Engineering Rising Stars Fellowship Program is a fully funded, immersive summer residential research initiative that brings the best Canadian undergraduate students to the University of Waterloo. Rising Stars Fellows will be immersed in research work for 16+ weeks at Canada's top engineering school. Rising Star Fellows will receive funding, on-campus housing (including a meal plan) and ample opportunities to experience the University of Waterloo's cutting-edge research activities and facilities. Take a summer term to dive deep into a research area of interest while working directly with world-renowned faculty members and a vibrant graduate student community. Waterloo Engineering Rising Stars Fellows will also network with Waterloo's tech and entrepreneurial ecosystem (such as Communitech and Velocity) to expand their professional and personal connections and kick off their future research career. At the end of the program, Fellows may be offered a Waterloo Engineering funded graduate student position to fast-track their research career after the completion of their current studies. About the University of Waterloo The University of Waterloo is one of Canada's premiere research universities. It is consistently ranked #1 in Canada for experiential learning and graduate employment. The University of Waterloo offers leading research expertise in engineering and computer science among a diverse portfolio of other programs. Duration: May 11th to August 21st, 2026 Funding: On-campus housing,meals and program activities will be provided by the program PLUS you will earn a $5,500 stipend as a Fellow. The program will also reimburse 50% of travel expenses within Canada up to a maximum of $500. The combined value exceeds $16, 000 for the term, or over $27/hour. Timeline: Applications will be reviewed on an ongoing basis. The final application submission deadline is January 31st, 2026. All applicants will be notified of decisions on their applications by Feb. 28th, 2026. Please Note We will not be able to respond to individual queries but all applications adhering to the requirements stated above will be evaluated, and all applicants will be notified of the decision. If you would like to update information in your application or correct an error before the submission deadline, please feel free to submit a revised application, and we will evaluate your latest submission. Job Requirements Eligibility: • Undergraduate students enrolled in at least the second year of an Engineering or Architecture program at a Canadian University who will be returning to their undergraduate studies after the completion of the Rising Stars Program.. Application Process: After receiving the application for participation in the program, it will be reviewed by the program team. Shortlisted students will be invited for an online interview. Successful participants will receive an offer letter, followed by an acceptance letter and onboarding instructions. All applicants will be notified of decisions on their applications. Research Focus: You will be asked to identify your research interests. Let us know where your research interest aligns with our world-class facilities and faculty research experts, and we will match our Rising Star Fellows with a Waterloo Engineering research team. Explore our graduate studies Research and Supervisors pages to identify the research topics and experts that best match your interests and aspirations.
